definition: the multitude against the few, a wide disparity (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered/unequally matched/overwhelmed by weight of numbers
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]
few/scant/widowed
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
different/unique/special/very/(classical) to behead/to die/to cut off/to separate/to surpass

sentences.english: The girl was brave enough, but as being outnumbered, she was finally knocked by the gang.
sentences.chinese: 她很英勇，但终因众寡悬殊，被那帮人打晕从前。

sentences.english: The girl was brave enough, but as being outnumbered, she was finally knocked down by the gang.
sentences.chinese: 她很英勇，但末因众寡悬殊，被那帮人打晕过去。

definition: multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers

out of ammunition and no hope of reinforcements (idiom); in desperate straits
a blood soaked and hard-fought struggle (idiom)
to fight with all one's might
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
fight to the death/desperate struggle
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
troops under one's command
Japanese army (derog.) (old)
to intercept and attack (military)
defenders
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
bloody battle
the Qing army
to fight/to struggle/to wage war
